results.title: Dracula
results.brief_description: A seductive and elegant screen adaptation of the stage version of Bram Stoker’s immortal classic Dracula, penned by Hamilton Dean and John L. Balderston.
results.description: A seductive and elegant screen adaptation of the stage version of Bram Stoker’s immortal classic Dracula, penned by Hamilton Dean and John L. Balderston. On a storm-lashed sea, a ship bearing mysterious cargo is thrown into disorder by both the fierce conditions and the bizarre deaths of most of the crew. High above the cliffs of the English coast, another form of chaos ensues as the inmates of Dr. Seward’s asylum react badly to the storm, while his daughter Lucy’s companion, Mina Van Helsing, is lured from her sick-bed to rescue the only survivor of the shipwreck. The charming but enigmatic Count Dracula quickly ingratiates himself into Seward’s home, and spellbinds Mina, who is soon found dead under bizarre circumstances. Overwhelmed by guilt, Seward contacts Mina’s father, Professor Van Helsing, who promptly appears to investigate the cause of his daughter’s death, only to discover the true identity of their beguiling guest. However, the Count has already set his sights on Lucy, and Van Helsing and Lucy’s bewildered fiance Jonathon Harker must confront the demon interloper if they are to save her from a fate worse than death. Frank Langella stars as Dracula (a role reprised from the stage adaptation), with Sir Laurence Olivier as Van Helsing, Donald Pleasence as Dr. Seward, and Kate Nelligan as Lucy. Features an atmospheric soundtrack by composer John Williams, performed by the London Symphony Orchestra.
description_for_label: A seductive and elegant screen adaptation of the stage version of Bram Stoker’s immortal classic Dracula, penned by Hamilton Dean and John L. Balderston. On a storm-lashed sea, a ship bearing mysterious cargo is thrown into disorder by both the fierce conditions and the bizarre deaths of most of the crew. High above the cliffs of the English coast, another form of chaos ensues as the inmates of Dr. Seward’s asylum react badly to the storm, while his daughter Lucy’s companion, Mina Van Helsing, is lured from her sick-bed to rescue the only survivor of the shipwreck. The charming but enigmatic Count Dracula quickly ingratiates himself into Seward’s home, and spellbinds Mina, who is soon found dead under bizarre circumstances. Overwhelmed by guilt, Seward contacts Mina’s father, Professor Van Helsing, who promptly appears to investigate the cause of his daughter’s death, only to discover the true identity of their beguiling guest. However, the Count has already set his sights on Lucy, and Van Helsing and Lucy’s bewildered fiance Jonathon Harker must confront the demon interloper if they are to save her from a fate worse than death. Frank Langella stars as Dracula (a role reprised from the stage adaptation), with Sir Laurence Olivier as Van Helsing, Donald Pleasence as Dr. Seward, and Kate Nelligan as Lucy. Features an atmospheric soundtrack by composer John Williams, performed by the London Symphony Orchestra.

results.title: Dracula
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Nightmare: the birth of horror”.
Appearing on screen in over 200 different incantations, the character of Dracula is the most famous of horror icons and set the template for a mass horror movement. Taking Bram Stoker’s novel as the basis, writer and presenter Professor Christopher Frayling traces the origins of the vampire myth and the inspiration behind the novel - a combination of nightmare, literary influences, location and personal anecdotes. Frayling reviews the existing documentation of Stoker’s notes and moves through how the story came into being, the process Stoker took in writing the novel, and how it has developed, been interpreted and reinterpreted since then, in comic strips, melodramas and motion pictures.

results.title: Dr. T & the women = Dr T and the women [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, James McLindon and Sandcastle 5
results.brief_description: ‘Dr.T & the women’ brings together an ensemble cast including Richard Gere, Helen Hunt, Farrah Fawcett and Kate Hudson. Gere plays Dr.T, a Dallas gynaecologist with a bevy of beautiful women who worship him. With his daughter’s wedding imminent, his wife’s lack of mental stability, his alcoholic sisters and her 3 children, it’s no wonder he finds solace in the arms of Bree, new pro teacher at the golf club.

results.title: Dr. Strangelove or How I learned to stop worrying and love the bomb [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Stanley Kubrick, Victor Lyndon and Columbia
results.brief_description: A crazy General, Jack D. Ripper, obsessed by the fear that the Communists are controlling the fluoridation of the U.S. water supply, unleashes his wing of H-bombers against Russia. The President of the United States, his Chiefs of Staff at the Pentagon and even the sinister Dr. Strangelove, realise it is too late to call off the attack so they await the awesome consequences. This controversial black comedy stars Peter Sellers in three separate roles; other stars include George C. Scott, Sterling Hayden and Slim Pickens. In turn hilarious, satirical and even terrifying, Dr. Strangelove is a guide on How To Stop Worrying and Love The Bomb.

results.title: Dr. No (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Terence Young, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Dr.No was the first extraordinary adventure of the world’s most famous spy: James Bond. Sean Connery is 007: suave, charming and fearless; an expert on weapons, women, martinis and just about everything. Dr. No, a fanatical scientist plots to overtake the world but is ultimately defeated. Ursula Andress made her first screen appearance in the film. While there is no famous title song, the well-known James Bond theme and elaborate opening title sequences by Maurice Binder have become part of the James Bond legend.

results.title: Dr. No
results.brief_description: In 1962, audiences were introduced to the suave super spy James Bond in the first instalment of the classic franchise, <.i>Dr. No. Bond, James Bond has since shot up the screen 25 times and become a pop-culture icon.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

results.description: Dr. No is a 1962 spy film directed by Terence Young. It is based on the 1958 novel of the same name by Ian Fleming. Starring Sean Connery, Ursula Andress, Joseph Wiseman, and Jack Lord, it is the first film in the James Bond series, and was adapted by Richard Maibaum, Johanna Harwood, and Berkely Mather.
description_for_label: Dr. No is a 1962 spy film directed by Terence Young. It is based on the 1958 novel of the same name by Ian Fleming. Starring Sean Connery, Ursula Andress, Joseph Wiseman, and Jack Lord, it is the first film in the James Bond series, and was adapted by Richard Maibaum, Johanna Harwood, and Berkely Mather.

results.title: Dr. No
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Terence Young, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Dr. No was the first extraordinary adventure of the world’s most famous spy: James Bond. Sean Connery is 007: suave, charming and fearless; an expert on weapons, women, martinis and just about everything. Dr. No, a fanatical scientist, is a member of the terrorist organisation SPECTRE, which plans to conquer the world. However, thanks to the daring of James Bond, Dr. No is ultimately defeated. Ursula Andress made her screen debut in the film. While there is no famous title song, the well-known James Bond theme, elaborate opening title sequences by Maurice Binder and the magnificent locations were present from this first film and have now become part of the James Bond legend.
